item.title: Drawing the Yin and Yang Symbol with D3.js
item.description: The JavaScript code in this post shows how you can draw the yin and yang symbol using the D3.js.

item.title: pydoc3 builtins
item.description: A short screencast showing how to use the command `pydoc3` to access the Python documentation in the terminal on a Linux based operating system.

item.title: pydoc3 -b
item.description: A short screencast showing the output of the command `pydoc3 -b` in a terminal on a Linux based operating system.

item.title: Get Information from Wikipedia via DNS TXT Record Queries
item.description: A short screencast showing how to issue DNS TXT record queries to retrieve information from Wikipedia in a terminal on a Linux based operating system.

item.title: Read a Description of the Linux Filesystem Hierarchy
item.description: Quickly access a description of the directories you typically find in a Linux filesystem by typing `man hier` in a terminal.

item.title: Have You Ever Typed "git" More Often in One Command?
item.description: A short screencast showing how you can clone the git source tree from GitHub.

item.title: Use Objexplore for Inspecting and Debugging Python Code
item.description: A short screencast demonstrating the Python package objexplore with the builtins Python module.

item.title: Quickly Access the ASCII Table from a Terminal
item.description: A short screencast showing the output of the command `man ascii` in a terminal on a Linux based operating system.

item.title: Automating Browser Screenshots for Social Media using wcap and Pillow
item.description: An article describing how I automated the creation of social media images for two websites with graphics rendered in JavaScript by using screenshots.

item.title: Python Data Science Handbook: Essential Tools for Working with Data
item.description: A review of the Python Data Science Handbook, which covers IPython, NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib and machine learning with Scikit-Learn, and was written by Jake VanderPlas.

item.title: David Beazley: The Fun of Reinvention (Screencast)
item.description: In his keynote from PyCon Israel 2017 Python expert David Beazley talks about the fun of reinventing things and using and abusing new features in Python 3.6.

item.title: Free Image Search - Search for free images on multiple sites
item.description: Free Image Search is a meta search engine for free images hosted on sites such as Flickr, Openclipart, Pixabay and Wikimedia Commons.

item.title: Shirt Search - Search for Popular T-Shirts in Multiple Shops
item.description: Search for best-selling and top-rated t-shirts in online shops such as Amazon, Redbubble, Teepublic and Zazzle.

item.title: Drawing Ramones Style Circular Text with D3.js
item.description: Example JavaScript on how to draw circular text as seen in the Ramones logo with SVG paths and SVG text elements using the D3.js API.

item.title: Everything is 4 in English Network Graph
item.description: When you take any word in English and count its letters, then count the number of letters in that numeral and so on, you'll end up at 4.

item.title: Installing and Setting up Python on Shared Hosting
item.description: This tutorial outlines the steps of installing and setting up Python on a shared hosting platform and how to enable the creation of virtual environments.

item.title: Gift Ideas for Programmers Day
item.description: A list of gift ideas for programmers to celebrate programmers day on September 13 or September 12 in leap years.

item.title: Magic Numbers Shirt Generator
item.description: Pick a magic hexspeak number to print it on a shirt for computer programmers and geeks.

item.title: Customizing Matplotlib's Plotting Styles
item.description: A tutorial on how to customize the look and feel of plots created with the Matplotlib library for Python.

item.title: Almost every 3rd Monacan is a Millionaire
item.description: According to research from WealthInsight these are the world's top 20 cities with the highest millionaire density. Monaco leads the pack followed by Zurich and Geneva.

item.title: Gender Comparison: Would you Tell your Weight?
item.description: A look at the results of a poll about whether people disclose their body weight and how to present results of such a pool using data visualization.

item.title: Automating Browser Tasks without Distraction on Ubuntu
item.description: How to automate browser tasks on Ubuntu using Selenium from Python without displaying a browser window.

item.title: Pycon 2015: Beyond PEP 8 by Raymond Hettinger
item.description: This talk from PyCon 2015 by Raymond Hettinger is about how to leverage Python language features to writer better and more beautiful code.

item.title: A Simple Hack to Write Better Commit Messages
item.description: This article describes a simple and effective method to write better commit messages for people who commit directly from the command line.

item.title: Drawing the New York Hardcore Logo with D3.js
item.description: Example JavaScript code of how you can draw the New York Hardcore (NYHC) logo with D3.js using SVG shapes and text.
